reply.question: 2. If the app declares the collection of data, what type of data does it collect?

answer.full_answer: The app collects personal identifiers, contact information, health-related information, assessment responses, gameplay performance data, medical information, payment information, technical information, and other submitted information.

reply.analysis: The answer is derived from the specific types of data listed in the privacy policy document that the app collects from users. These types include personal identifiers, contact details, health information, assessment results, gameplay data, medical info, payment details, technical information, and various other submitted details.
reply.reference: The app collects various types of data, such as personal identifiers, contact information, health-related information, assessment responses, gameplay performance data, medical information, payment information, technical information, and other submitted information. URL: https://my.akili.care/privacy

reply.question: 3. Does the app declare the purpose of data collection and use?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the purpose of data collection and use.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly outlines the specific purposes for which data is collected and used.
reply.reference: Your data will be used only: ... to help us evaluate, improve, and troubleshoot our products and services; ... to monitor and analyze usage and trends regarding our products and services; ... to detect, protect against, and address any error, fraud, wrongdoing, or illegal activity, and/or to enforce our Terms of Use or carry out our legal responsibilities; ... for any other purpose that is communicated to you ... URL: https://my.akili.care/privacy

reply.question: 4. Can the user opt out of data collection or delete data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the user can opt out of data collection or delete data by contacting info@akiliinteractive.com.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy states that users can review, delete, or modify any collected data by simply contacting the provided email address.
reply.reference: If at any time you would like to review, delete, or modify any of your data that we’ve collected, please simply contact us at info@akiliinteractive.com. Akili will not discriminate against you for exercising any rights you may have under any applicable data privacy or security laws or regulations. Please note that Akili may retain certain of your data for applicable legal, regulatory, or other reasons that are permitted by applicable data privacy laws and regulations. URL: https://my.akili.care/privacy

reply.question: 5. Does the app share data with third parties?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app shares data with third parties.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy mentions sharing data with other caregivers, healthcare professionals, pharmacies, and for various purposes such as feedback collection, product improvement, and scientific analysis.
reply.reference: to share any of the data with other individuals, such as sharing with other caregivers or physicians specifically identified by you; - to share relevant content with you related to pediatric ADHD or attention difficulties; - if applicable, to communicate with your pharmacy for the purposes of fulfilling or dispensing any prescription you’ve received for EndeavorRx™ treatment; URL: https://my.akili.care/privacy

reply.question: 6. If the app shares data with third parties, what third parties does the app share data with?

answer.full_answer: The app may share data with caregivers, physicians specifically identified by the user, partners, and individuals for specific purposes.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy mentions sharing data with caregivers, physicians specifically identified by the user, partners, and individuals for specific purposes. These parties are granted access for specific reasons outlined in the policy.
